title: Bill Goldsmith says he'd happily return to Bachelor In Paradise
text:
He may not have had the best time on Bachelor In Paradise, but that hasn't deterred Bill Goldsmith from wanting to return to the reality dating show.

In an interview with The Daily Telegraph on Monday, the 32-year-old Bachelorette alum claimed he'd happily appear on Paradise again.

'I'm not going to bag out the show but I would say I'm not the bad guy I was portrayed as,' he told The Daily Telegraph.

Making a comeback: He may not have had the best time on Bachelor In Paradise, but that hasn't deterred Bill Goldsmith from wanting to return to the reality dating show

'For sure I would love to do the show again.'

Bill was branded a player during his stint on Bachelor In Paradise earlier this year after he stepped out with Florence Alexandra while dating Alex Nation.

But Bill denied that was what actually happened, claiming the show edited him to look like the bad guy.

Back for more: In an interview with The Daily Telegraph on Monday, the 32-year-old Bachelorette alum claimed he'd happily appear on Paradise again

'The thing that really got me is that Alex and I were the only legitimate couple to finish the season and they chose to still portray me in that drama rather than showing the one true love story that actually happened,' he added.

Taking to Instagram in April shortly after his appearance on the show, Bill admitted he wished he'd handled things differently.

'Looking back on my time in Paradise, I'd like to think I'd handle the same situation a lot differently,' he wrote at the time.

Dating around: Bill was branded a player during his stint on Bachelor In Paradise earlier this year after he stepped out with Florence Alexandra while dating Alex Nation (pictured)

'I was navigating my way through a range of emotions in an environment like no other on this planet.'

He later claimed the show's producers had 'f***ed my reputation', responding to a fan's comment on Instagram.

'[They] have f***ed me over all for their ratings, and literally f***ed my reputation. I'm pretty hurt by the whole thing,' he wrote.

authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
